meanings.definition: A circular ornamental headdress worn by a monarch.
meanings.sent1: The shiny crown sparkled on the king's head.
meanings.sent2: The queen's crown was adorned with precious gems.
meanings.sent3: The crown looked too heavy for the tiny prince to wear.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the hall, her joy a crown for all to see.
meanings.sent5: The crown gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of royal power.

meanings.definition: The top or highest part of something.
meanings.sent1: The mountain's snowy crown glistened in the morning light.
meanings.sent2: The crown of the tree swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The cake's cherry crown made it look too pretty to eat.
meanings.sent4: The crown of the building reached towards the sky, touching the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The crown of the hill offered a breathtaking view of the valley below.

meanings.definition: To declare or acknowledge someone as a champion or winner.
meanings.sent1: The crowd cheered to crown the victorious athlete.
meanings.sent2: The judges will crown the best singer of the competition.
meanings.sent3: The playful cat seemed to crown itself the ruler of the house.
meanings.sent4: Her smile crowned her as the kindest person in the room.
meanings.sent5: The golden trophy will crown the winner of the contest.

meanings.definition: To cover or encircle the top of something.
meanings.sent1: The snow will crown the mountain peaks in winter.
meanings.sent2: The flowers beautifully crowned the wedding cake.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to crown the dish with a sprinkle of herbs.
meanings.sent4: The rainbow crowned the waterfall, creating a magical scene.
meanings.sent5: The sunset's colors crowned the horizon with a fiery glow.
